tips.title: Ensure Safety First
tips.content1: Wait for Authorities: Do not return to your home or the affected area until authorities declare it safe. Listen to local news and follow official instructions.
tips.content2: Wear Protective Gear: When inspecting your property, wear proper protective clothing, including gloves, masks, and long-sleeved shirts, to avoid exposure to ash and debris.

tips.title: Contact Insurance Company
tips.content1: Notify Your Insurance Provider: Contact your insurance company as soon as possible to report the damage. Document the damage with photographs and videos before cleaning up or making any repairs.
tips.content2: Understand Your Policy: Understand what your insurance policy covers. Ask questions if you are uncertain about any aspect of your coverage.

tips.title: Document & Assess Damage
tips.content1: Document Extensively: Take photographs and videos of the damage to your property and belongings. This documentation will be crucial for insurance claims and disaster assistance applications.
tips.content2: Make a Detailed Inventory: Understand what your insurance policy covers. Ask questions if you are uncertain about any aspect of your coverage.

tips.title: Seek Disaster Assistance
tips.content1: Apply for Assistance: While government programs may not provide immediate recovery and relief, we recommend that you still apply for assistance from government programs.
tips.content2: Get help by sharing your story below: Connect with others who've faced the same natural disaster and express your needs. Together, we can match your needs with generous donors who are looking to provide 1-to-1 support.

tips.title: Take Care of Yourself
tips.content1: Monitor Health: Pay attention to your physical and mental health. Wildfire aftermath can be stressful; seek medical attention if you feel unwell.
tips.content2: Seek Support: Don't hesitate to talk to friends, family, or a mental health professional about your feelings. Natural disasters can be emotionally overwhelming, and it's essential to seek support when needed.

tips.title: Assess Structural Damage
tips.content1: Inspect Foundations: Check for cracks or shifts in your home's foundation. Structural integrity is vital for safety.
tips.content2: Examine Walls and Roofs: Look for water damage, warping, or discolouration on walls and ceilings. Address any visible issues promptly.

tips.title: Health Precautions
tips.content1: Avoid Contaminated Water: Do not consume or come into contact with floodwater, as it may contain harmful bacteria or chemicals.
tips.content2: Protective Gear: Use gloves, masks, and boots when cleaning up to minimize exposure to contaminants.
